title: 113_hr1133
content: The Act may be cited as the "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2013". It pertains to presidential libraries. The "Presidential Library Donation Reform Act of 2013" amends Section 2112 of title 44, United States Code, by adding a new subsection requiring Presidential library fundraising organizations to report information on contributors who donate $200 or more in a calendar quarter. The Archivist must publish information submitted by Presidential library fundraising organizations on the National Archives website within 30 days. Submission of false material information is prohibited. Submission of false material information is prohibited for individuals and organizations making contributions to Presidential library fundraising organizations. Violations will result in penalties under section 1001 of title 18, United States Code. It is unlawful for any Presidential library fundraising organization to knowingly submit false information or omit material information. Penalties under section 1001 of title 18, United States Code, apply for violations. Making contributions to Presidential library fundraising organizations knowingly and willfully is also prohibited. The Archivist must promulgate regulations regarding violations related to making contributions to Presidential library fundraising organizations in someone else's name or accepting contributions made by one person in the name of another. Penalties for violations are outlined in the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971. The Archivist is required to create regulations for carrying out the subsection related to contributions to Presidential library fundraising organizations. The term 'information' includes the amount and source of each contribution, as well as the occupation of individual contributors. The term 'Presidential library fundraising organization' refers to an organization established to raise funds for Presidential archival depositories. Section 2112(h) of title 44, United States Code applies to organizations raising funds for these purposes. The Presidential library fundraising organization raises funds for Presidential archival depositories, with restrictions on contributions made after the enactment of this Act.
